main event: Three irregularly shaped objects, glowing reddish-white color, were observed moving slowly and silently over Easton, Maryland on 6/30/1957.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 15-20 seconds before disappearing.
Three red and CAP light planes were spotted in the area shortly before the sighting.
amber glow bands apparent on the objects suggest some internal mechanism.
The 15-20 second observation of the glowing objects seemed to indicate an extremely rapid departure rather than a flight.
sighted object: three irregularly shaped, glowing reddish-white objects
